title: Tracking issue for enabling multiple CGUs in release mode by default

labels.name: C-tracking-issue
labels.description: Category: A tracking issue for an RFC or an unstable feature.

body:
I'm opening this up to serve as a tracking issue for enabling multiple codegen units in release mode by default. I've written up a [lengthy summary](https://internals.rust-lang.org/t/help-test-out-thinlto/6017) before but the tl;dr; is that multiple codegen units enables us to run optimization/code generation in parallel, making use of all available computing resources often speeding up compilations by more than 2x.

Historically this has not been done due to claims of a loss in performance, but the [recently implemented ThinLTO](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/44841) is intended to assuage such concerns. The most viable route forward seems to be to enable multiple CGUs and ThinLTO at the same time in release mode.

[Performance summary](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/45320#issuecomment-337957101)

**Blocking issues:**

* [x] ~~[ThinLTO exposes too many symbols](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/46374)~~ - [fixed](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/46382)
* [x] [Enable for rustc on all platforms](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/45400)
* [x] Enable for libstd on all platforms
  * ~~[first attempt](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/45529)~~ - ~~[blocked on presumed LLVM bug](https://bugs.llvm.org/show_bug.cgi?id=35140)~~ - ~~[Rust tracking issue](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/45654)~~ - ~~[fixed](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/45806)~~
  * ~~[blocked on test failures](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/45661#issuecomment-341620033)~~ - ~~[current presumed cause of test failures](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/45511)~~ - ~~[next attempt](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/46008)~~
* [x] ~~[Possible build-time regressions using multiple CGUs in debug mode](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/44941)~~ - [couldn't reproduce](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/44941#issuecomment-338034984)
* [x] ~~[Reported build time regression in rust-doom](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/45188)~~ - [couldn't reproduce](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/45188#issuecomment-337369426)
* [x] ~~[ThinLTO broken some MSVC rlibs](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/45347)~~ - [fixed](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/45348)
* [x] [More bad debuginfo](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/46346) - [propoxed fix](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/46772)

**Potential blockers/bugs:**

* [ ] [ThinLTO broke sanitizers](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/45220)
* [ ] [ThinLTO for libstd breaks the leak sanitizer](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/46126)
* [x] [ThinLTO may break debuginfo](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/45511) - ~~[proposed fix](https://reviews.llvm.org/D39981)~~ - ~~[update to rust](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/46008)~~
* [ ] [ThinLTO breaks msp430 (and other non-integrated assembler targets)](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/45836)
